title: Worked Solution
text:
The slope-intercept form of a line is given by:
$$y=mx+b$$
Where $$m$$ is the slope of the line and $$b$$ is the y-intercept, which is the point where the line crosses the y-axis.
In this case, the slope of the line is given as $$-3$$ and the point through which the line passes is $$(4,8)$$. We can use these two pieces of information to write the equation of the line.
Substituting the values into the slope-intercept form, we get:
$$y=-3x+b$$
To find the value of $$b$$, we can substitute the coordinates of the point $$(4,8)$$ into the equation and solve for b:
$$8=-3\left(4ight)+b$$
$$8=-12+b$$
$$20=b$$
So the y-intercept of the line is $$(0,20)$$.
Therefore, the equation of the line in slope-intercept form is:
$$y=-3x+20$$
This is the final equation.
